comments.body:
Running the linter locally can help you figure out the problem but if I had to guess it would be this line.
All those `, " and ' maybe be messing up the recipe parser.
It's not those. It's the `outputs:` section. The convoluted sequence of escape characters went through fine in earlier commits.
(The section `outputs` is simply not in the list, so the check for the correct order of sections fails)
Thanks for the clarification. I don't have a laptop with me right now to check it (only a phone), but I'll take a look at this soon. (Unless you sort it out before me ðŸ˜„)
A PR adding it to https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-smithy/blob/master/conda_smithy/lint_recipe.py#L16 should fix that then.

Exactly my thinking, hence: conda-forge/conda-smithy#518

(The open question there is whether the `outputs` section should go between `build` and `requirements` or between `requirements` and `test`, not that it matters)

You are way ahead of me. (Still getting up to speed after PyCon).

I would like for it to be between `requirements` and `test`. (I'll comment in the PR.)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +64,68 @@test:
  commands:
    - 'test "`uil 2>&1| tr -d ''\n''`" = "Severe: no source file specified"'
    - conda inspect linkages -p $PREFIX $PKG_NAME  # [not win]
    - conda inspect objects -p $PREFIX $PKG_NAME  # [osx]
